title: Ticket #4451: compare null hostnames in same_host COLLECTOR_HOST 127.0.0.1
description:
If you specify COLLECTOR_HOST=127.0.0.1, on startup the condor_master will complain: 

07/08/14 16:25:43 Master restart (GRACEFUL) is watching /tmp/8.2-test/condor-8.2.1-x86_64_RedHat6-stripped/sbin/condor_master (mtime:1403893350)
07/08/14 16:25:43 Warning: attempting to compare null hostnames in same_host.
07/08/14 16:25:43 Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618

(The interesting line is the one in the middle, other others are for context.)

This warning is unexpected. COLLECTOR_HOST=localhost and COLLECTOR_HOST=128.105.14.138 (the machine's public address) work as expected, the master emits no such warning.

Potentially related: #4452: Collector port not defined, will use default: 9618 localhost 127.0.0.1
creator: adesmet
